abstract: Office of United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon acknowledges UN's complicity in initial outbreak of cholera in Haiti and says that UN will do more to address crisis; statement stops short of saying UN caused epidemic, nor does it change organization's stance that it is not legally liable.

headline.print_headline: Facing Stern Report, U.N. Admits Role in Haiti’s Cholera Outbreak
headline.main: U.N. Admits Role in Cholera Epidemic in Haiti

keywords.value: United Nations Stabilization Mission in Haiti
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The acknowledgment came after a confidential report told the secretary general that the outbreak, which began in 2010, “would not have broken out but for the actions of the United Nations.”...
lead_paragraph: The acknowledgment came after a confidential report told the secretary general that the outbreak, which began in 2010, “would not have broken out but for the actions of the United Nations.”
